name: Sodium hypochlorite
desc: Sodium hypochlorite is a chemical compound with the formula NaClO. It is composed of a sodium cation (Na+) and a hypochlorite anion (ClO−); it may also be viewed as the sodium salt of hypochlorous acid. When dissolved in water it is commonly known as bleach or liquid bleach. Sodium hypochlorite is practically and chemically distinct from chlorine. Sodium hypochlorite is frequently used as a disinfectant or a bleaching agent.
Other names:
Antiformin
Bleach
Chloride of soda


In dilution:


Carrel-Dakin solution
Modified Dakin's solution
Surgical chlorinated soda solution

Bleach
Chloride of soda

Safety data sheet:
ICSC 1119 (solution, >10% active chlorine)
ICSC 0482 (solution, <10% active chlorine)
Other anions:
Sodium chloride
Sodium chlorite
Sodium chlorate
Sodium perchlorate
